title: Multimedia Learning Design to Improve Text-Image Integration Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Basic reading comprehension and ability to interpret visual materials
context.additional_context: Learners perform text-image integration tasks using personal devices, with project-based assessments measuring learning outcomes. Design considerations include characteristics of non-academic learners (e.g., reduced concentration).

learning_goals: Learners can construct concept maps by connecting text and images from multimedia materials with 80% accuracy.
Learners can apply a strategic gaze—alternating between text and images—at a frequency of 70% or higher during task performance.
During complex problem-solving processes, learners can continuously explore materials for 15+ minutes, reducing dropout rates to 20% or lower.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
